title: Firefox Inspector - Ignore version string when debugging JavaScript
content:
When using Firefox inspector to debug JavaScript, if the version string of the file (eg `<somefile>.js?v=12345`) changes by the server, Firefox Inspector assumes that it is a new source file and thus clears any breakpoints for the file on reload.

Is there a way to disable this such that the Inspector assumes it is the same file?

There are cases where the server actively changes the version on the fly and thus makes debugging very tricky.

Seems like Firefox is blocking the microphone on this one site.

title: FF not downloading files
content:
I am using a site with both a download icon and an open icon. The issue is not limited to this site or the file type. I have no issue when using Chrome.

FF won't download PDF file when I click the download icon. It will sweep the tab with a blue background but never open the downloads window. It will open the PDF file when I click the open icon. What to do with PDF is set to OPEN in FF.

I change what to do with PDF from OPEN to ASK. It now will not open the PDF when I click the open icon but instead of asking it gives a blank screen. If I click the download icon it does the same as above.

I change it to SAVE, and it will open the downloads window and save when I click either the open or the download icon. It will give a blank screen first on clicking the open icon.

Nothing is blocked, Popups are allowed for this site, I have all extensions and plugins disabled, but it does not do this in safe mode. So, something else must be disabled in safe mode that I have not found yet. What could it be?????? I really do not want to refresh it.
creator: bill.ruggirello

title: Best approach to backup browsing session
content:
Hello,

Foreword: i already had problem with FF browsing session when i had two windows open and somehow the secondary with not important tabs was closed as the last one and then there was problem to restore the main one.

Question: So in short i have important session open and two browser windows and i want to make a quick backup of the main one or of the both sessions and be able to restore all the opened tabs from this backup easily.

What is the best approach to do it?

Related FAQ: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/back-and-restore-information-firefox-profiles#w_backing-up-your-profile But it is about profile, not just opened tabs and it is manual task, not some built in GUI function.

My OS and findings: I am on Linux and i have found this: $ cd ~/.mozilla/firefox/; ls -l $ cd myprofilename/sessionstore-backups;ls -lt recovery.jsonlz4 recovery.baklz4 previous.jsonlz4 upgrade.jsonlz4-202010... ... Do i have to quit FF, then backup the sessionstore-backups and then after i want restore, do the same but only replace the folder? Is there more simple, better way?

title: Audio not playing only in certain cases
content:
The problem:

At first glance audio playback seems to work but there are cases where no sound can be heard, such as:

  1. The audio previews on this site;
  2. This specific yt video. most of the yt videos DO play audio;
  3. An .mp4 video i wanted to see on somebodys else google drive;

In most other cases yt and sites such as bandcamp do work. In all cases, regardless of the audio actually playing or not, the Firefox "VU meter" in the Windows Mixer utility shows activity.

What has been tried:

  1. Reinstalling motherboard drivers: nothing
  2. Launching Firefox in safe mode without add-ons: doesnt work;
  3. Changing output device from speakers to HDMI audio, to try if the integrated speakers in the monitor do play the sound: it works;
  4. Trying the same sources listed above on Google Chrome: they all work fine;
  5. Testing Firefox on a fresh Windows installation in a new partition: no version of Firefox i tried worked (latest, 80 and 69.01);

I really have no idea how to fix this, can somebody help me?

title: All Firefox shortcuts etc. deleted when I restart Windows
content: I add Firefox to my taskbar and lock the taskbar. I pin Firefox to my Start menu. I put a shortcut to Firefox on my desktop. I have even created a new folder on my desktop with a different name and made the contents "read only". I have made Firefox my default Web browser. No matter what I do - if I restart this laptop all of the above goes away. All Firefox appearances disappear. A couple days ago, Firefox even disappeared from my Start menu list of all programs. It's still installed, but I have to navigate to its location to open it. What else can I do? Is Microsoft doing this on purpose?

title: Send Tab from Firefox desktop to android devices doesn't work properly
content:
I tried to use "Send tab to device" function between my Windows and Android phone. When I sent a tab from android device to PC, the new tab opened on PC immediately. But if I tried to send a tab from PC to android device, I couldn't get notification on my phone. New tabs ONLY appears when I tapped the "sync now" button mannually(see following picture), in fact I saw my account synced automatically on android every few minutes without any issue.

I use Firefox international account in China, the synchronization process is a bit slow, but it still works fine, so I don't why this "send tab to android device" function doesn't work normally? Note:Most of the time, I use cellular network on my phone.
